title: Welcome
text:
Welcome to my new website! I’ve rebuilt this site using Quarto — a modern open-source scientific publishing system. I’ll be using this blog to share updates on my research, teaching, and thoughts on spatial data science.
Stay tuned for more posts.

title: Teaching
text:
I contribute to GEOG0030, UCL’s undergraduate module on geocomputation and spatial analysis using R.

GEOG0030 Coursebook




A collection of R tutorials covering GIS topics including geocoding, network analysis, and greenspace accessibility.

R GIS Tutorials




A practical guide to using AI tools (including LLMs) for GIS and spatial analysis workflows.

title: Research
text:
My research focuses on transport geography, urban mobility, and spatial data science. I am particularly interested in how spatial analysis and network methods can be applied to understand accessibility, travel behaviour, and urban systems.



Transport and accessibility modelling
Spatial data science and GIS methods
Network analysis of urban systems
Active travel and sustainable transport

title: Jo Wilkin
text:
Geographer and spatial data scientist, using Geographic Data Science “for good”. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
Currently a Research Scientist at Tracking California (Public Health Institute), applying spatial analysis to public health and environmental justice across California — from dataset curation to mapping tool development.

title: Jo Wilkin
text:
Current work

Statewide road network dataset for Vehicle Miles Traveled in California, with bespoke interpolation methodology in Python
R Shiny apps for environmental justice, including the Lithium Valley Data Explorer and a Community Air Quality Monitoring Data Explorer
Household-level network Origin-Destination analysis for healthcare accessibility modelling

title: Jo Wilkin
text:
Previously
Lecturer in Geographic and Social Data Science at UCL, teaching spatial analysis, geocomputation, and the ethics and politics of data science. Developed and led three modules across undergraduate and postgraduate programmes.
PhD at the University of Southampton on creating geospatial datasets from Call Detail Records for humanitarian applications, mapping social networks and community resilience. Research with the WorldPop group and Flowminder Foundation. Presented at NetMob (Oxford) and Geo4Dev (UC Berkeley).
Helped launch The Missing Maps Project in the UK, leading mapathons and developing training material still in use today. Presented at the Royal Geographical Society and Oxford Internet Institute. Creator of an award-winning Geography Programming Bootcamp teaching Python for GIS research.
